description: From Middle English entune, entone, from Old French entoner, from Medieval Latin inton≈ç.

verbs.description: intone (third-person singular simple present intones, present participle intoning, simple past and past participle intoned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give tone or variety of tone to; to vocalize.
(transitive) To utter with a musical or prolonged note or tone; to speak or recite with singing voice; to chant.
(intransitive) To utter a tone; utter a protracted sound.
